alert.note: Alert for Oldham (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 3:48PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Oldham County through 415 PM CDT... At 347 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of Adrian, or 16 miles northwest of Vega, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Oldham County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
